data.question: What is the chemical formula for the synthesized bismuth ellagate MOF known as SU-101?
What method was used for the structure determination of SU-101?
At what temperature was SU-101 activated before gas adsorption experiments?
What is the BET surface area of SU-101 synthesized using reagent-grade ellagic acid after washing with water and ethanol?
What is the estimated isosteric heat of adsorption for SO2 in SU-101?
What was the H2S adsorption capacity of SU-101 in the first cycle?
What was the result of the cytotoxicity study of SU-101 on HL-60 cell line at 1000 µg.mL-1 concentration?
Is the synthesis of SU-101 scalable?
Does SU-101 maintain its structure after exposure to humid SO2?
Can SU-101 be synthesized using ellagic acid sourced from pomegranate hulls?
Was the SO2 capture capacity of SU-101 constant over 50 adsorption-desorption cycles?
Did SU-101 show any signs of degradation after being exposed to solutions with pH levels ranging from 2 to 14?
data.answer: No, it remained intact over a large pH-range, 2 < pH ≤ 14

data.question: What was the method used to confirm the phase purity of SU-101?
What was the main purpose of using 3D electron diffraction (3DED) in the study of SU-101?
data.answer: To solve the structure of SU-101

data.question: Is SU-101 biocompatible based on the cytotoxicity tests performed?
What was the main challenge in the synthesis of SU-101?
What was the role of acetic acid in the synthesis of SU-101?
data.answer: It acted as a modulator to improve phase purity and synthesis reproducibility

data.question: Was the thermal stability of SU-101 tested under different atmospheres?
data.answer: Yes, under vacuum, nitrogen, and air

data.question: Did the study explore the use of SU-101 for drug delivery applications?
data.answer: Yes, it was considered for environmental and biological applications, including drug delivery

data.question: What was the unique feature of SU-101 that contributed to its high H2S adsorption capacity?
data.answer: The formation of polysulfides inside its pores
